description: The FAA says it is investigating a whistleblower's claims about flaws in the assembly of Boeing's 787 Dreamliner. The company calls those allegations inaccurate, and insists the plane is safe to fly.
title: A Boeing whistleblower raises fresh concerns about the 787, and the FAA investigates

description: The Clifford family was as prepared as possible to welcome Terrance the octopus. But there was one thing they missed: she was pregnant. And then she laid a whole lot of eggs.
title: Terrance the octopus came to live with a family. Then she laid dozens of eggs

description:
Many of us don't have the opportunity to handpick our neighbors. We buy or rent a place in a neighborhood with good schools or an easy commute.

Some of us become friends with those who live nearby, others of us never talk to our neighbors at all. For most though, we co-exist.

In the midst of a brutal civil war, neighbors killed their neighbors simply because of who they were.

Thirty years ago this month, that wasn't the case in Rwanda.

We visit a Rwandan village where how neighbors live alongside one another is deliberate, and complicated.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: Learning To Live As Neighbors In The Shadow Of A Brutal, Violent History

description: Understandably, a movie about the man who steered the development of atomic bombs is seen differently in a country where some 200,000 people were killed by those bombs. "Oppenheimer" opened in Japan 8 months after premiering in the U.S.  Our reporter talks to movie goers in Nagasaki, Japan.
title: How is the Movie "Oppenheimer" Being Received in Japan?

description: Higgs predicted the existence of the Higgs boson particle, helping explain how matter formed after the Big Bang. His death at 94 was announced by the University of Edinburgh, where he was a professor.
title: Peter Higgs, who proposed the existence of the so-called 'God particle,' has died

description: Jurors will be asked to identify the the news and social media programs they use, podcasts they listen to and if they have supported or been a member of white supremacist and extremist groups.
title: Here are the 42 questions on the juror questionnaire in Trump's hush money case

description: Both Crumbleys were convicted on four counts of involuntary manslaughter over the 2021 shooting at Michigan's Oxford High School carried out by their son, Ethan Crumbley, who was 15 at the time.
title: James and Jennifer Crumbley, school shooter's parents, sentenced to 10-15 years

description: The Arizona Supreme Court has ruled that an old law from the 1860s can stand in the state, outlawing nearly all abortions.
title: The Arizona Supreme Court allows a near-total abortion ban to take effect soon

description: Norfolk Southern has agreed to settle a class-action lawsuit stemming from the fiery train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio in early 2023.
title: Norfolk Southern will pay $600 million to settle East Palestine derailment lawsuit

description: Authorities in the Russian republic of Chechnya will only allow music between 80 and 116 beats per minute, though it's unclear how the rule will be enforced.
title: Chechnya is banning music that's too fast or slow. These songs wouldn't make the cut

description: Palestinian citizens make up 20% of Israel's population, and many grieve the suffering in Gaza. Hundreds were arrested or lost jobs for questioning the war there, and doing so can still be perilous.
title: Israel's Palestinian citizens grow louder in protesting the Gaza war

description: The shortlist for the Carol Shields Prize was announced Tuesday morning. The award recognizes "creativity and excellence in fiction by women and non-binary writers in Canada and the United States."
title: One of these novelists will receive the $150K Carol Shields Prize

description: Trump says abortion should be left to states, the Vatican released a new document calling gender theory a "grave threat" to society.
title: Trump says abortion should be left to states; Vatican takes stance on gender theory

description: Europe's highest human rights court ruled Tuesday that its member nations have an obligation to protect their citizens from the ill effects of climate change.
title: European court rules on cases seeking to force countries to meet climate goals

description: Teen vaping is trending downwards these days. But data from Colorado and around the country show the generation that made Juul cool is still hooked on nicotine.
title: Young adults who started vaping as teens still can't shake the habit

description: A new report finds more election officials are leaving their jobs now than at any point in the past two decades. But the report also adds new context to the phenomenon.
title: The most detailed look yet at the 'exodus' of local voting officials

description: Europe's highest human rights court began its session Tuesday on a group of climate change cases aimed at forcing countries to meet international obligations to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
title: Is climate change action a human right? A European court will rule for the first time

description: A new lunar time zone is all about ensuring the success of future, multinational missions to the moon.
title: NASA has been asked to create a time zone for the moon. Here's how it would work

description: Sam McAlister was the BBC booker who persuaded Prince Andrew to go on record about his friendship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. It's the subject of new Netflix movie Scoop.
title: The true story behind Netflix's 'Scoop' and the Prince Andrew interview on Epstein

description: Ten years after the mass abduction of 276 Chibok schoolgirls, kidnapping in Nigeria continues to rise. Nearly 1,000 people were kidnapped in the first three months of 2024. Here is one family's story.
title: For one Nigerian family, freedom after a kidnapping hasn't ended their terror

description: When siblings share a womb, sex hormones from a male fetus can cause lasting changes in a female littermate. This effect exists for all kinds of mammals — perhaps humans too.
title: In the womb, a brother's hormones can shape a sister's future

description: About 20 years ago, Arkansas started weighing children in school and sending home letters to try to combat obesity. Even though obesity rates only have risen, many other states picked up the policy.
title: Arkansas led the nation sending letters home from school about obesity. Did it help?

description: For the 10th consecutive month, Earth set a new monthly record for global heat — with both air temperatures and the world's oceans hitting an all-time high, the European Union climate agency said.
title: March is 10th straight month to be hottest on record, scientists say
